index.md.name: Documentation Index
index.md.description: Navigation guide for all Hugr MCP resources and prompts. Overview of available documentation, tools, and key principles.

overview.md.name: Hugr Overview
overview.md.description: Architecture overview: Data Sources → Modules → Objects/Functions. Module hierarchy (core.sales.analytics), auto-generated queries, special table types (Cube, Hypertable), and row-level security (RLS) considerations.

data-types.md.name: Data Types and Operations
data-types.md.description: Field types explained (table fields vs subqueries/relations/aggregations), filter operators by data type (String, Int, Boolean, Timestamp, JSON, Geometry), list operators (any_of/all_of/none_of for relations), aggregation functions by type, boolean logic (_and/_or/_not), distinct_on, sorting enums (ASC/DESC), and common filter patterns.

schema-structure.md.name: Schema Structure
schema-structure.md.description: Type system, introspection strategy (CRITICAL: always introspect), filter operators by type, aggregation system, cube tables with @measurement fields, H3 clustering, and semantic search capabilities.

query-patterns.md.name: Query Patterns
query-patterns.md.description: Decision tree for choosing the right approach. PRIORITY #1: Relation filters (any_of/all_of/none_of, deep nesting). Use _join only when no relation exists. distinct_on for unique values. Anti-patterns (two queries, Python). jq transformations. Mandatory validation workflow.
